poem:
"Misleading Haste"

In the thrum and rush of night,
Two strangers bound by a blunder;
A groom's grip too tight,
On his journey, his bride left asunder.

Rural horizons stretch in the haze,
India's heart pulses in the deafening drum.
Two lives intersect in life's labyrinthine maze,
Under stars, they fumble, in silent conundrum.

A comedy of errors unveiled by dawn,
Tales woven in the loom of haste, yawn.
